name: Sadagaat
mission: Sadagaat seeks to contribute to improving the educational services of the poor segments by focusing on the education of special groups (children who are not enrolled in schools and the blind), in addition to improving the educational environment, building the capacities of the educational staff, and providing opportunities for professional education.
theoryOfChange: Empowering marginalized communities through a combination of immediate emergency relief (food/water) and sustainable development (education/infrastructure) to break the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

score_details.score_summary: SADAGAAT-USA shows strong impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SADAGAAT-USA holds a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and maintains a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and provides guidance on zakat policy and asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $1,294,453 and a program expense ratio of 98.4%.
SADAGAAT-USA operates programs in education, healthcare, feeding, and water sectors.
The charity provides resources for supporters to create their own fundraising campaigns to support its mission.
The organization offers multiple donation options and giving methods for supporters.
SADAGAAT-USA provides opportunities for volunteer engagement and community involvement.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SADAGAAT-USA earns a strong overall profile due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct impact on high-urgency domestic and international poverty needs.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital reserves, currently maintained at 3.6 months
Reliance on direct provision models which may require high ongoing operational oversight

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a high donor fit for the Muslim community, the charity is Zakat-eligible and addresses urgent causes related to poverty and education [2][7]. The organization also encourages community engagement through structured volunteer opportunities and peer-to-peer fundraising initiatives [6][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining a total revenue of $1,294,453 with a 98.4% program expense ratio [1][3]. Its effectiveness is reflected in a high Charity Navigator rating and a 37/50 impact score, supported by transparent financial reporting and low fundraising costs of $0.01 per $1 raised [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: SADAGAAT-USA is a highly efficient humanitarian organization dedicated to improving educational services and essential infrastructure for vulnerable populations.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.4%, ensuring nearly all funds reach beneficiaries
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100
baseline_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA focuses on empowering marginalized groups through specialized education for the blind and out-of-school children, while also managing critical sectors in healthcare, feeding, and water provision [4][6]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through supported asnaf categories [2].

case_against.summary: The primary limitation is a <cite id="15">lack of standardized beneficiary reporting</cite>, which makes it difficult to calculate the exact cost-effectiveness of their interventions.

data_gaps: Missing consistent beneficiary counts for cost-effectiveness analysis
confidence.notes: Strong financial and accountability data, though impact measurement is still maturing.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="5">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="6">fuqara and masakin</cite> in high-need regions.
alignment.improvement: The charity could <cite id="17">expand services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage to maximize its alignment score.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="11">100% independent board</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of all $1.29M in revenue.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could <cite id="16">formalize its developing theory of change</cite> into a published strategic document.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite>, though the <cite id="15">cost per beneficiary remains unverified</cite> due to missing specific beneficiary counts.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">publishing consistent beneficiary data</cite> to enable third-party cost-effectiveness analysis.

rich_narrative.headline: SADAGAAT-USA is a highly efficient humanitarian organization dedicated to improving educational services and essential infrastructure for vulnerable populations.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their entire contribution to go directly to humanitarian relief in Sudan.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% of their donation reaches the field
Care about specialized education for the blind and marginalized
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations through a highly-rated, transparent organization
Value direct provision of water, health, and food aid
giving_considerations: The organization is mid-sized with a $1.3M budget
Impact is focused on Sudan, a region with high humanitarian urgency
Financial transparency is excellent, but impact data is still maturing
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking large-scale global advocacy or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence of long-term educational outcomes

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while <cite id="20">outcome metrics are tracked</cite>, the lack of consistent beneficiary data prevents a higher rating.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SADAGAAT-USA aims to combat the 'Poverty-Ignorance-Disease' cycle through <cite id="19">direct provision of education, health, and water services</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Consistent evidence ensures that the 100% program spend is translating into the most effective possible outcomes for the poor.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="21">33.4% revenue CAGR</cite> and expanding needs in Sudan, the charity has significant capacity to absorb more capital.
strategic_priorities: Expanding educational access for the blind

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="4">98.4% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="9">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>.
SADAGAAT-USA holds a <cite id="10">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and a <cite id="8">97.97.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>.
Programs target highly marginalized groups, including <cite id="7">educational services for the blind</cite> and out-of-school children.

strengths_deep_dive: SADAGAAT-USA demonstrates a robust commitment to financial stewardship, evidenced by its <cite id="11">100% independent board members</cite> and perfect scores of <cite id="12">100 in both Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator. Their operational model is designed for maximum donor impact, utilizing <cite id="13">direct provision of services</cite> to ensure aid reaches beneficiaries without intermediary loss. Furthermore, the organization maintains <cite id="14">3.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient financial cushion for its humanitarian operations in volatile regions like Sudan.
rich_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a highly efficient humanitarian organization primarily focused on <cite id="1">improving educational services and essential infrastructure</cite> for vulnerable populations in Sudan and the United States. The organization operates across five critical sectors, including <cite id="2">feeding, water, health, education, and crisis relief</cite>. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,294,453</cite>, which was almost entirely derived from public contributions. A defining characteristic of SADAGAAT-USA is its extreme lean operational model, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 98.4%</cite> according to recent financial filings. This ensures that donor funds are directed almost exclusively to frontline services rather than administrative overhead. The organization is <cite id="5">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the asnaf categories of <cite id="6">the poor (fuqara) and the needy (masakin)</cite>. Beyond basic relief, the charity emphasizes specialized education, focusing on <cite id="7">children not enrolled in schools and the blind</cite> to break cycles of poverty. Their impact is further validated by a <cite id="8">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting top-tier performance in accountability and financial health.
